channel.title: Free the Geek.fm - The podcast about the business of freelancing as a software developer, writer, content producer, and all round PHP lover.
channel.description: A fireside chat on the ins and outs of being a freelance writer, screencaster, teacher, and software developer. Looking at what it’s like to do it, warts and all, as well as how to get started, what to expect, the good, the bad, and the ugly. When we’re not talking that, we’re talking tech, code, apps, development, and of course PHP.
channel.itunes:author: FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter
channel.itunes:subtitle: The podcast about the business of freelancing as a software developer, writer, content producer, and all round PHP lover
channel.itunes:summary: A fireside chat on the ins and outs of being a freelance writer, screencaster, teacher, and software developer. Looking at what it’s like to do it, warts and all, as well as how to get started, what to expect, the good, the bad, and the ugly. When we’re not talking that, we’re talking tech, code, apps, development, and of course PHP.

item.title: Episode 001 – Getting Underway, The E-Myth Revisited, and Networking For Success
item.dc:creator: settermjd
item.description: In this, the first episode, Matt talks about what lead to the podcast getting started who motivated him and inspired him to get started. After that, he discusses a fantastic book that all freelancers should read, one which explains how you need to approach freelancing if you want to succeed, and you want to keep your sanity; it's called the E-Myth Revisited. Finally, Matt discusses why networking is essential to success, and some of the mistakes that some of techies make.
item.content:encoded: In this, the first episode, Matt talks about what lead to the podcast getting started who motivated him and inspired him to get started. After that, he discusses a fantastic book that all freelancers should read, one which explains how you need to approach freelancing if you want to succeed, and you want to keep your sanity; it's called the E-Myth Revisited. Finally, Matt discusses why networking is essential to success, and some of the mistakes that some of techies make.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this, the first episode, Matt talks about what lead to the podcast getting started, an excellent book for Freelancers, called the E-Myth Revisited, and why networking is essential to freelancing success.
